answers.answer: hi sarah and welcome!Are you seeing and endo that specializes in thyroid or diabetes?? It makes a big difference. I think I would seek a second opinion to be sure. Has your heart rate increased at all?What thyroid antibody test did you have done? What was the lab range for that test?

question: Hello every bodyi'm 29 years old i did thyroid function test one month back and TSH .09 with T4 16  , thyroid antibody M 1:400i discussed this result with endocinology according to them no need treatment since you are asymptomatic just repeat  i repeated after one month and came as TSH .008 with T4 19  also in same time i discovered i'm pregnanta littlebit my weigt coming down otherwise no other symptoms, also i asked again endocrinologist again and according to them just wait and repeated again and their explanation for goinig more low TSH because pregnancy?!i'm so worried is this beginning of hyperthyrodism ?do i have to start treatment now?is it affect my baby in this time?sincerely yours
title: i'm so worried
